creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
provenance:
John Barnard (d.1784), cf. Lugt 1419, London [1]; Alleyne Fitzherbert, 1st Baron St. Helens (1753-1839), cf. Lugt 2970, London ('until d. 1839, 'his sale, Christie's, London, May 26, 1840)[2].  [Colnaghi, London; until 1970; sold, July 2, for £750, to Mia]

[1] Barnard's 1787 drawing sale (February 16-23, Greenwood, London), with approximately 800 sheets, has not been checked. but large group lots would make individual drawings difficult to identify.

[2] Baron St. Helens sale catalogue ("Drawings by ancient masters of the Italian, French, and Dutch schools," Christie's, London, May 26, 1840) has not been checked. A copy is in the Frick Reference Library.
title: Two Putti Covering a Cartouche on a Pediment with a Tapestry Representing a Lute Player in a Landscape
